shortcuts.command: Open whatever panel you used last
Switch back to whatever docking tools used last
Search for text within the current panel. Not supported in the Audits, Application, and Security panels  Command + F
Opens the Search tab in the Drawer
Open a file in the Sources panel

shortcuts.shortcut: cmd+o (to open the cmd menu, then type !, followed by the name of the script, then) enter

shortcuts.command: Select the element above / below the currently-selected element
Expand the currently-selected node. If the node is already expanded, this shortcut selects the element below it
Collapse the currently-selected node. If the node is already collapsed, this shortcut selects the element above it
Expand or collapse the currently-selected node and all of its children
shortcuts.shortcut: (hold) opt (then click the arrow icon next to the element's name)

shortcuts.command: Toggle Edit Attributes mode on the currently-selected element
Select the next / previous attribute after entering Edit Attributes mode
Toggle Edit as HTML mode on the currently-selected element
Go to the line where a property value is declared
Cycle through the RBGA, HSLA, and Hex representations of a color value
shortcuts.shortcut: (hold) shift (then click the col/preview box next to the value)

shortcuts.command: Select the next / previous property or value
shortcuts.shortcut: (click a property name / value then press) tab/shift+tab

shortcuts.command: Increment / decrement a property value by 0.1
Increment / decrement a property value by 1
Increment / decrement a property value by 10
Increment / decrement a property value by 100
Pause script execution (if currently running) or resume (if currently paused)
Continue to a certain line of code while paused
shortcuts.shortcut: (hold) cmd (then click the line of code)

shortcuts.command: Select the call frame below / above the currently-selected frame
Jump to a line number of the currently-open file
shortcuts.shortcut: cmd+o (to open the cmd menu, type:followed by the line number, then press) enter

shortcuts.command: Jump to a column of the currently-open file (for example line 5, column 9)
shortcuts.shortcut: cmd+o (to open the cmd menu, type:then the line number, then another :, then the column number, then) enter

shortcuts.command: Go to a function declaration (if currently-open file is HTML or a script), or a rule set (if currently-open file is a stylesheet)
shortcuts.shortcut: cmd+shift+o (then type in the name of the declaration / rule set, / select it from the list of options)

shortcuts.command: Delete all characters in the last word, up to the cursor
Add or remove a line-of-code breakpoint
shortcuts.shortcut: (focus your cursor on the line and then press) cmd+b

shortcuts.command: Toggle single-line comment. If multiple lines are selected, DevTools adds a comment to the start of each line
Select / de-select the next occurrence of whatever word the cursor is on. Each occurrence is highlighted simultaneously
Force a multi-line entry. Note that DevTools should detect multi-line scenarios by default, so this shortcut is now usually unnecessary
Expand all sub-properties of an object that's been logged to the Console
